TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit AccessViolationException extends System.SystemException

summary.span: 在试图读写受保护内存时引发的异常。

span.span: The exception that is thrown when there is an attempt to read or write protected memory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当代码尝试读取或写入到尚未分配的或不能访问的内存，则将发生访问冲突在非托管或不安全代码。An access violation occurs in unmanaged or unsafe code when the code attempts to read or write to memory that has not been allocated, or to which it does not have access. 这通常是因为指针具有错误值。This usually occurs because a pointer has a bad value. 并非所有通过无效指针的读或写操作都会导致访问冲突，所以访问冲突通常指示已经通过无效指针进行多次读或写操作，并且内存内容可能已损坏。Not all reads or writes through bad pointers lead to access violations, so an access violation usually indicates that several reads or writes have occurred through bad pointers, and that memory might be corrupted. 因此，访问冲突几乎总是指示编程错误。Thus, access violations almost always indicate serious programming errors. 清楚地标识这些严重错误。An clearly identifies these serious errors. 在程序中完全由可验证的托管代码组成，所有引用都是有效或者为空，并都会产生访问冲突。In programs consisting entirely of verifiable managed code, all references are either valid or null, and access violations are impossible. 尝试引用为空引用中可验证代码，则会引发任何操作异常。Any operation that attempts to reference a null reference in verifiable code throws a exception. 发生仅可验证的托管的代码进行交互时与非托管代码或不安全的托管代码。An occurs only when verifiable managed code interacts with unmanaged code or with unsafe managed code. ## AccessViolationException 异常的疑难解答Troubleshooting AccessViolationException exceptions 异常仅出现在不安全托管代码或代码时可验证托管与非托管代码交互：An exception can occur only in unsafe managed code or when verifiable managed code interacts with unmanaged code: - 在不安全的托管代码中发生了访问冲突可以表示为任一异常或异常，具体取决于平台。An access violation that occurs in unsafe managed code can be expressed as either a exception or an exception, depending on the platform. - 冒泡到托管代码的非托管代码的访问冲突总是包装在异常。An access violation in unmanaged code that bubbles up to managed code is always wrapped in an exception. 在任一情况下，您可以确定并更正的原因异常，如下所示：In either case, you can identify and correct the cause of the exception as follows: 确保您尝试访问的内存已分配。Make sure that the memory that you are attempting to access has been allocated. 尝试访问受保护的内存--即，以访问的内存，并且不分配或不归进程始终引发异常。An exception is always thrown by an attempt to access protected memory -- that is, to access memory that is not allocated or that is not owned by a process. 自动内存管理是公共语言运行时提供的服务之一。Automatic memory management is one of the services that the common language runtime provides. 如果托管的代码提供了与 unmanagede 代码相同的功能，您可能希望移至托管代码才能利用此功能。If managed code provides the same functionality as your unmanagede code, you may wish to move to managed code to take advantage of this functionality. 有关详细信息，请参阅 [Automatic Memory Management](~/docs/standard/automatic-memory-management.md)。For more information, see [Automatic Memory Management](~/docs/standard/automatic-memory-management.md). 确保您尝试访问的内存未损坏。Make sure that the memory that you are attempting to access has not been corrupted. 如果多次读或写操作时都遇到无效指针，则内存可能已损坏。If several read or write operations have occurred through bad pointers, memory may be corrupted. 这通常发生时读取或写入到外部的预定义的缓冲区的地址。This typically occurs when reading or writing to addresses outside of a predefined buffer. ## AccessViolationException 和 try/catch 块AccessViolationException and try/catch blocks 从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]，由公共语言运行时引发的异常未由`catch`如果异常发生在由公共语言保留的内存外的结构化的异常处理程序中的语句运行时。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], exceptions thrown by the common language runtime are not handled by the `catch` statement in a structured exception handler if the exception occurs outside of the memory reserved by the common language runtime. 若要处理此类异常，则应该应用属性引发异常的方法。To handle such an exception, you should apply the attribute to the method in which the exception is thrown. 此更改不会影响用户代码，可以继续通过捕获引发的异常`catch`语句。This change does not affect exceptions thrown by user code, which can continue to be caught by a `catch` statement. 你想要重新编译并无需修改即可运行的.NET framework 的早期版本编写的代码[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]，可以添加[ \](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/legacycorruptedstateexceptionspolicy-element.md)元素应用应用程序的配置文件。For code written for previous versions of the .NET Framework that you want to recompile and run without modification on the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], you can add the [\](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/legacycorruptedstateexceptionspolicy-element.md) element to your app's configuration file. 请注意，也可能会收到通知的异常是否已定义的处理程序或事件。Note that you can also receive notification of the exceptions if you have defined a handler for the or event. ## 版本信息Version Information 在.NET Framework 2.0 及更高版本中会引发此异常。This exception is thrown in the .NET Framework 2.0 and later versions. 在早期版本的.NET Framework，由表示非托管的代码或不安全托管的代码的访问冲突在托管代码中。In earlier versions of the .NET Framework, an access violation in unmanaged code or unsafe managed code is represented by a in managed code. 一个时为 null 引用取消引用在托管代码中可验证，不涉及数据损坏，匹配项，并没有方法来区分版本 1.0 或 1.1 中的两种情况也会引发。A is also thrown when a null reference is dereferenced in verifiable managed code, an occurrence that does not involve data corruption, and there is no way to distinguish between the two situations in versions 1.0 or 1.1. 管理员可以允许所选应用程序恢复到.NET Framework 1.1 版的行为。Administrators can allow selected applications to revert to the behavior of the .NET Framework version 1.1. 将以下行中的放置[<运行时>元素](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/runtime-element.md)部分中的应用程序的配置文件：Place the following line in the [<runtime> Element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/runtime-element.md) section of the configuration file for the application: ``` ```

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.span: 使用由系统提供的用于描述错误的消息初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class with a system-supplied message that describes the error.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此构造函数初始化为系统提供的描述错误的消息的新实例的属性如"尝试读取或写入受保护的内存。This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Attempted to read or write protected memory. 这通常是指示的其他内存已损坏。"This is often an indication that other memory has been corrupted." 此消息将当前系统区域性考虑在内。This message takes into account the current system culture. 下表显示 的实例的初始属性值。The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of . |PropertyProperty|“值”Value| |--------------|-----------| ||`null`。`null`.| ||本地化的错误消息字符串。The localized error message string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

param.name: message

span.span: The message that describes the exception.

param.span: 此构造函数的调用方需要确保此字符串已针对当前系统区域性进行了本地化。

span.span: The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

summary.span: 使用指定的描述错误的消息初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified message that describes the error.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 下表显示 的实例的初始属性值。The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of . |PropertyProperty|“值”Value| |--------------|-----------| ||`null`。`null`.| ||`message` 中指定的错误消息字符串。The error message string specified in `message`.|

summary.span: 用序列化数据初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此构造函数在反序列化过程中调用，以便重建通过流传输的异常对象。This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. 有关详细信息，请参阅[XML 和 SOAP 序列化](~/docs/standard/serialization/xml-and-soap-serialization.md)。For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/docs/standard/serialization/xml-and-soap-serialization.md).

related.span: XML 和 SOAP 序列化

param.name: message

span.span: The message that describes the exception.

param.span: 此构造函数的调用方需要确保此字符串已针对当前系统区域性进行了本地化。

span.span: The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

param.name: innerException

span.span: The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

param.span: 如果 参数不为 ，则当前异常将在处理内部异常的 块中引发。

span.span: If the parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.

summary.span: 使用指定的错误消息和对作为此异常原因的内部异常的引用来初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 因前一个异常而直接引发的异常应在 属性中包含对前一个异常的引用。An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the property. 属性返回的值与传递到构造函数中的值相同；或者，如果 `null` 属性没有向构造函数提供内部异常值，则为 。The property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor. 下表显示 的实例的初始属性值。The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of . |PropertyProperty|“值”Value| |--------------|-----------| ||`null`。`null`.| ||`message` 中指定的错误消息字符串。The error message string specified in `message`.|
